pullRequest.title: Issue #14198: Transform passwordUtilities-1.0 feature so it works wit…

beforeCommit.message: Issue #14198: Transform passwordUtilities-1.0 feature so it works with JakartaEE 9.

afterCommit.message: Issue #14198: Transform passwordUtilities-1.0 feature so it works with JakartaEE 9.

nodes.bodyText: Previously this only depended on the API feature and not the public feature.  So this should be io.openliberty.jakarta.connectors.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.autoPasswordUtilities1.0.jakarta
+IBM-Provision-Capability: \
+ osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.passwordUtilities-1.0))", \
+ osgi.identity; filter:="(&(type=osgi.subsystem.feature)(osgi.identity=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-5.0))"
+IBM-Install-Policy: when-satisfied
+-features=\
+ com.ibm.websphere.appserver.authData-2.0, \
+ io.openliberty.appSecurity-4.0, \
+ io.openliberty.appserver.connectors-2.0, \

nodes.bodyText: Is this supposed to be commented out?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@

+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+src: \
+  fat/src,\
+  test-applications/WebsphereUserRegistry/src,\
+  test-applications/PasswordUtilAPI/src
+
+fat.project: true
+
+#tested.features: el-4.0, appsecurity-4.0, servlet-5.0, cdi-3.0, jsp-3.0, jaxb-3.0, jaspic-2.0, jacc-2.0

nodes.bodyText: Should this say WAS or should it say Liberty?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -15,3 +15,4 @@ com.ibm.ws.security.authorization.jacc.ejb=io.openliberty.security.authorization
 com.ibm.ws.security.authorization.jacc.web=io.openliberty.security.authorization.internal.jacc.web,,"Security Web support for JACC 2.0 Service","Security Web support for JACC 2.0 Service"
 com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.jacc=io.openliberty.jacc.2.0,,"JACC Service Provider Interface","JACC Service Provider Interface, version 2.0"
 com.ibm.ws.security.authentication.filter=io.openliberty.security.authentication.internal.filter,,"Security Authentication filter","Security Authentication filter"
+com.ibm.ws.security.auth.data=io.openliberty.security.auth.internal.data,,"WAS Security Auth Data APIs","WAS Security Auth Data APIs; Jakarta Enabled"

nodes.bodyText: Can you make this file and symbolic name be io.openliberty instead of com.ibm.websphere.appserver?

This should be moved to the auto feature and the com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData bundle should be transformed to have a jakarta version.  The transformed one would be in the jakarta auto feature of course.  Yeah I know the pom will be wrong, but that is something to be fixed later.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,18 +2,18 @@
 symbolicName=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.passwordUtilities-1.0
 visibility=public
 IBM-ShortName: passwordUtilities-1.0
-IBM-API-Package: com.ibm.websphere.security.jca; type="ibm-api", \
+IBM-API-Package: \
+ com.ibm.websphere.security.jca; type="ibm-api", \
  com.ibm.websphere.crypto; type="ibm-api", \
- com.ibm.websphere.security.auth.data; type="ibm-api",
+ com.ibm.websphere.security.auth.data; type="ibm-api"
 Subsystem-Name: Password Utilities 1.0
--features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.authData-1.0, \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.appSecurity-1.0; ibm.tolerates:="2.0, 3.0", \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.javax.connector-1.6; ibm.tolerates:=1.7, \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.0; ibm.tolerates:="3.1, 4.0", \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.transaction-1.1; ibm.tolerates:=1.2
--jars=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData; location:=dev/api/ibm/, \
+-features=\
+ com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.0; ibm.tolerates:="3.1, 4.0, 5.0"
+-jars=\
+ com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData; location:=dev/api/ibm/, \

nodes.bodyText: Similar to the bundle the javadoc should be moved to the auto feature and a jakarta one created if we do that.  Not sure if we do yet.  If not maybe it can remain here for now.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -2,18 +2,18 @@
 symbolicName=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.passwordUtilities-1.0
 visibility=public
 IBM-ShortName: passwordUtilities-1.0
-IBM-API-Package: com.ibm.websphere.security.jca; type="ibm-api", \
+IBM-API-Package: \
+ com.ibm.websphere.security.jca; type="ibm-api", \
  com.ibm.websphere.crypto; type="ibm-api", \
- com.ibm.websphere.security.auth.data; type="ibm-api",
+ com.ibm.websphere.security.auth.data; type="ibm-api"
 Subsystem-Name: Password Utilities 1.0
--features=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.authData-1.0, \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.appSecurity-1.0; ibm.tolerates:="2.0, 3.0", \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.javax.connector-1.6; ibm.tolerates:=1.7, \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.0; ibm.tolerates:="3.1, 4.0", \
- com.ibm.websphere.appserver.transaction-1.1; ibm.tolerates:=1.2
--jars=com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData; location:=dev/api/ibm/, \
+-features=\
+ com.ibm.websphere.appserver.servlet-3.0; ibm.tolerates:="3.1, 4.0, 5.0"
+-jars=\
+ com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData; location:=dev/api/ibm/, \
  com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.passwordUtil; location:=dev/api/ibm/
--files=dev/api/ibm/javadoc/com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData_1.0-javadoc.zip, \
+-files=\
+ dev/api/ibm/javadoc/com.ibm.websphere.appserver.api.authData_1.0-javadoc.zip, \
